title: Compressor 4.2
description:
Compressor adds power and flexibility to Final Cut Pro X export. Customize output settings, work faster with distributed encoding, and tap into a comprehensive set of delivery features.

Advanced Encoding for Final Cut Pro
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Use Compressor to customize encoding settings available in Final Cut Pro
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Choose from a wide array of codecs, sizes, frame rates, and other parameters
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Save your custom settings in Compressor; they automatically appear in Final Cut Pro
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Share settings with other editors, even if Compressor isn't installed on their workstations
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Easily create an iTunes Store Package for iTunes Store submission

Efficient Encoding Workflow
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Work fast in a modern, single-window interface with preset Destinations for common encoding tasks
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Experiment freely with encoding options and zoom in the Viewer to watch content with true pixel accuracy
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Display and assign channels to QuickTime audio tracks prior to processing
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Set up batch processes to streamline the encoding of large numbers of files
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Build custom Destinations to combine encoding with tasks such as moving or copying files
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Create self-contained Droplets to encode on the desktop with drag-and-drop ease
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Support for Industry Standards
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Encode to a broad range of industry-standard formats, such as MPEG-2, H.264, and ProRes
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Use one-step settings for Apple devices and websites such as Vimeo, YouTube, and
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Work with a choice of themed menus to encode and burn a DVD or Blu-ray disc
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Generate files for HTTP live streaming in a single step
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Import Targa, DPX, TIFF, PSD, or PNG image sequences and encode them to any setting
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Tap into advanced encoding features for adding closed captioning, metadata, and more

Pristine Format Conversions
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Convert any file between formats Ã¢â‚¬â€ such as NTSC to PAL or SD to HD
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Clean up and customize your content using image filters, a timecode overlay, and watermarks
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Speed up video, slow it down, or adjust the frame rate to make the duration match a runtime

Distributed Encoding
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Save time by distributing encoding work among multiple workstations
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Install Compressor on any Mac to activate it as a node for distributed encoding
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Speed up encoding in Final Cut Pro by choosing a group of shared computers for exporting

System Requirements: OS X v10.10.2 or later, 4GB of RAM (8GB recommended for 4K), OpenCL-capable graphics card or Intel HD Graphics 3000 or later, 256MB of VRAM (1GB recommended for 4K and 3D titles), 1.2GB of disk space.

Some features require Internet access; fees may apply. Blu-ray recorder required for burning Blu-ray discs
